The Scalatra community

Quite a few high-profile companies have incorporated Scalatra as part of their production systems. You can see the ones we know about on our Built with Scalatra page.

Twitter

@scalatra

Google group

The scalatra-user Google Group is an open forum. It is the preferred channel for discussion so future users can learn from the archive. Support requests, suggestions, project announcements, and all other commentary related to Scalatra are welcome here.

IRC

Because some issues are best discussed in real time, we are also on #scalatra on the Freenode IRC network.

GitHub

Development takes place through our GitHub project. Come here for issue tracking, code reviews, and patches.

Contributing to Scalatra

There are plenty of ways to contribute to Scalatra.

Join us on IRC (#scalatra at irc.freenode.net) if you need help with anything.

Issues can be reported to github.

Contributing to the documentation

This website is open source. Pull requests welcome. See forking and pull request sections of Github's help documentation to get started.

Need Help?

The Scalatra club is small, but lively and super-friendly. Join us on IRC at irc.freenode.org in #scalatra if you have any questions. It's a bit slow at times, so give us a bit to get back to your questions.
